thread.title: High still remembers last year's loss to Heights
thread.title_full: High still remembers last year's loss to Heights

author: Rick Peterson
title: High still remembers last year's loss to Heights
text:
High still remembers last year's loss to Heights Winless T-Birds to host undefeated Trojans Posted: October 8, 2015 - 4:41pm Photos FILE PHOTOGRAPH/THE CAPITAL-JOURNAL Topeka High's Mike McCoy, center, runs between Seaman defenders Nick Steiner, left, and Mike Latendresse during the first half of Friday night's game at Hummer Sports Park. McCoy will look to lead the Trojans past the Shawnee Heights T-Birds on Friday at Hummer Sports Park. By Rick Peterson rick.peterson@cjonline.com 
Undefeated Topeka High will be a huge favorite when it takes the field Friday night at Shawnee Heights (7 p.m. kickoff) against the winless T-Birds. 
And with a huge Class 6A district and league game against Manhattan looming a week from now, Friday night could be considered a trap game for Topeka High (5-0 overall, 4-0 in the Centennial League). 
But Trojan coach Walt Alexander is counting on the memory of last year's 28-21 overtime loss to the T-Birds (0-5, 0-4) to keep that from happening. 
“Like I told the kids, ‘Remember, they were 1-4 last year going into our game and what happened, they knocked us off in overtime,’ “ Alexander said of Shawnee Heights, the only city school to beat High since the 2011 season. “We will not be taking anything for granted whatsoever. 
“Coach (Jason) Swift always has those kids playing tremendously hard and they will never quit. They play hard from the first snap until the last snap of every game and they're going to give us their best shot. I have no doubt about that.” 
Topeka High is coming off a 52-7 win over Seaman last week and the Trojans have outscored their opposition by an average of 47 points per game. 
“Friday night was the most complete game we've played as far as all three phases and I thought the kids played tremendously hard defensively,” Alexander said. “It was fun to watch those guys. We played really well and hopefully we can continue that.” 
Trojan senior running back Mike McCoy rushed for 289 yards and four touchdowns on 17 carries against Seaman and he leads the city in rushing with 786 yards on 57 carries and in scoring with 17 touchdowns. 
High junior quarterback Corey Thomas leads the city with 1,073 total yards and is third in the city in passing with 643 yards and a city-high 13 touchdown passes. 
Shawnee Heights, a 5A state semifinalist a year ago, is coming off a 42-14 loss to Emporia last Friday, but Swift said the T-Birds are making progess with 5A district play looming next week. 
“We're getting better each day,” Swift said. “We're getting better on the practice field and it's starting to translate onto the game field. Come Friday night it's another way to see how much we've improved. 
“I'm very impressed with our guys. Our guys come back to work every Monday and they have the spirit of, ‘Let's do it. We believe in ourselves and let's keep working and not quit.' We go hard in practice and on Friday nights we're fighting.” 
Shawnee Heights senior running back Alex Sheikh is coming off a 134-yard rushing performance against Emporia and Sheikh ranks eighth in the city in rushing with 268 yards on 56 attempts. 
T-Bird junior quarterback Trey Brown has passed for 431 yards and three touchdowns despite missing time with an injury. FRIDAY'S OTHER CITY GAMES 
(All games at 7 p.m.) 
HAYDEN (4-1, 4-1) VS. TOPEKA WEST (1-4, 0-4) 
At Hummer Sports Park 
Hayden beat Highland Park 57-6 last Friday while Topeka West dropped a 50-7 decision to Manhattan. Hayden junior quarterback Dallas Crittenden is fourth in the city in total offense (734 yards) and second in passing (701 yards, seven touchdowns) while senior back Connor Schumacher is fourth in the city in rushing (42 attempts, 384 yards), second in pass receiving (23 catches, 257 yards) and second in scoring (10 TDs, 62 points). Topeka West junior quarterback Zach Shima has accumulated 1,000 total yards (second in the city) and he leads the city in passing (862 yards, eight touchdowns). West senior Jordan Newby leads the city in receiving (27 catches, 380 yards). 
WASHBURN RURAL (4-1, 4-1) AT HIGHLAND PARK (0-5, 0-4) 
Washburn Rural will be trying to bounce back from its first loss of the season, a 36-13 decision against undefeated Junction City. Highland Park is coming off a 57-6 loss to Hayden. Washburn Rural senior Matthew Williams is second in the city in rushing (94 attempts, 567 yards) while Highland Park sophomore Jerry Evans ranks sixth in the city (64-337). Washburn Rural senior quarterback Mitchell Schurig has passed for 447 yards and a touchdown, ranking fifth in the city. Highland Park senior quarterback Alex Rodriguez has accumulated 337 total yards for the Scots, who will be looking to end a 12-game losing streak. 
EMPORIA (2-3, 2-3) AT SEAMAN (0-5, 0-5) 
Emporia is coming off a 42-14 win over Shawnee Heights while Seaman dropped a 52-7 decision to unbeaten Topeka High last week. Emporia senior quarterback Tanner Taylor rushed for 130 yards and two touchdowns on 19 carries against Shawnee Heights and he passed for 102 yards and a TD. Seaman junior quarterback Dalton Cowan ranks fifth in the city in total offense (697 yards) and fourth in passing (535 yards, three touchdowns) while Viking senior Colton Moranz is fifth in the city in rushing (87-356). RICK'S PICKS 
Topeka High 42, Shawnee Heights 14 
Hayden 49, Topeka West 13 
Washburn Rural 35, Highland Park 6 
Emporia 35, Seaman 20 
Last week: 5-0 (1.000 pct.). Season: 23-3 (.885 pct.). 
Rick Peterson can be reached at (785) 295-1129 or rick.peterson@cjonline.com .
